content:
As far as I know, vervet monkeys do not store food for later. They are mostly opportunistic feeders and tend to consume food as soon as they find it. However, they are known to engage in food-sharing behaviors, especially with family members and other group members. 

Food sharing involves an individual who has found a source of food distributing it to other members of the group. This behavior helps to build social relationships and can be especially beneficial during times of food scarcity. Vervet monkeys have been observed sharing fruits, insects, and other food items with each other. However, as far as I know, they don't hoard or store food for future consumption.
